symptoms.name: Chancre
symptoms.pattern: Single, painless ulcer at the site of infection (anus)

physical_findings: Nontender lymph nodes in the inguinal region
risk_factors: Sex with a person who has syphilis

required: Clinical presentation consistent with primary syphilis (anal chancre)
Positive serological test for syphilis (e.g., RPR, VDRL, TRUST)
supportive: Positive darkfield microscopy or PCR for Treponema pallidum

differential_diagnoses: Other anorectal ulcers (e.g., herpes simplex, chancroid, granuloma inguinale)
